text: (upbeat music)

- I work both as a professor
at California State University
and as a software engineer at GBL Systems.

On campus, I use AWS
Academy to teach a lot
of our AWS curriculum.

Even the best students
don't have connections
in the industry.
What AWS does is it provides something
that we cannot deliver, which is building
from a business problem to a solution.

And for that you need
the industry experience.

AWS Academy allows us
to bring that industry
experience into our campus.

The partnership with AWS
allows us to have those

connections and allows
us to help the students
with writing resumes, with job interviews.
The AWS Academy works at both ends.

It is a bridge from the
undergraduate education
into the workforce for our students
for the institution, for the university,

it is also a way of attracting
students to our campus.

Students are excited
knowing that they're not

only learning the science
of computer science
but they're also learning the technology,

and they're becoming
familiar with a framework

that they will for sure
use upon graduation.
